intro: Psychotria flavicans, commonly known as the yellow psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to yellow. It typically grows as an undergrowth plant in humid, shaded environments. The leaves are usually elliptical or ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface.
